item.title: Laura add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Laura add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Laura add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Laura add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Laura add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Laura add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What strange creatures brothers are!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jim Elliot
item.description: "He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain that which he cannot lose." -- Jim Elliot

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Laura add a quote by Bill Hamon
item.description: "God does not call the qualified, but qualifies the called." -- Bill Hamon

item.title: Laura add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Laura add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Laura add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It's been many years since I had such an exemplary vegetable." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laura add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Prayer may just be the most powerful tool mankind has.” ~Blink" -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Once born into childlike faith, brimming with belief, typical people begin to lose their faith. Society mocks them. Their friends smirk. They come to change the world, but over time the world changes them. Soon they forget who they were; they forget the faith they once had. Then one day someone tells them the truth, but they don’t want to go back, because they’re comfortable in their new skin. Being a stranger in this world is never easy." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "…It’s not that you don’t have the capacity to accept the truth. You don’t want to accept it, and you hide behind your own logic and intelligence while the truth marches by. Step out and join it, for goodness’’ sake! Shout it out in full step! I believe!" -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Turn to the light. Don't fear the shadow it creates." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "That’s it?” Jason asked. “You spent an hour talking about how lucky you were to be dying?” No, not dying, Son. Living." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "Anything unnatural was not naturally believed. Faith, in essence, was unnatural." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "The world’s bumper sticker reads: Life sucks, and then you die. Perhaps Christian bumper stickers should read: Life sucks, but then you find hope and you can’t wait to die." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Ted Dekker
item.description: "The light had simply and utterly destroyed the darkness." -- Ted Dekker

item.title: Laura add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." -- Harper Lee
